title: Involvement
text:
I am an Intern with CREED (NC’s Center for Racial Equity in Education). I work in the Policy and Advocacy Department. We work to ensure all peopl in North Carolina have access to quality education. Creed Website
I previously worked for Appalachian Senior Programs as the Media Manager. I created weekly informational brochures for volunteers to promote education and inclusion to both programs under ASP. App Senior Programs Website
I currently work in the student learning center as a Peer Academic Leader (PAL). We host daily drop-in academic support andacademic workshop presentations. PAL Resources
In STT 2860, I learned to combine dat sets with R. Combining Data Sets

title: About Me
text:
I am a sociology major with minors in public health and statistics. I am pursuing a career in social research and data analysis. I am interested in researching areas of social justice, such as senior issues, LGBTQ+ issues, and criminal justice reform. My hobbies include film, writing, hiking, and playing with my cat Miso Soup.



Picture of Miso Soup

title: Combining Data Sets
text:
# install.packages('remotes')
# remotes::install_github('matthewhirschey/tidybiology',
# force = TRUE)
library(dplyr)
library(tidybiology)
data(happy)
data(happy_join_one)
data(happy_full)


title:“Problem Two” Problem One
Take a closer look at the three data frames - happy, happy_join_one, and happy_full

glimpse(happy)

Rows: 5
Columns: 4
$ country_name   <chr> "Iraq", "Comoros", "Panama", "Maldives", "Spain"
$ ladder_score   <dbl> 4.854, 4.289, 6.180, 5.198, 6.491
$ gdp            <dbl> 9.240, 8.031, 10.350, 9.826, 10.571
$ social_support <dbl> 0.746, 0.626, 0.896, 0.913, 0.932

glimpse(happy_join_one)

Rows: 5
Columns: 2
$ country_name            <chr> "Iraq", "Comoros", "Panama", "Maldives", "Spai…
$ healthy_life_expectancy <dbl> 60.583, 57.349, 69.652, 70.600, 74.700

glimpse(happy_full)

Problem Two
Combine happy and happy_join_one by row

bind_rows(happy, happy_join_one)

# A tibble: 10 × 5
   country_name ladder_score   gdp social_support healthy_life_expectancy
   <chr>               <dbl> <dbl>          <dbl>                   <dbl>
 1 Iraq                 4.85  9.24          0.746                    NA  
 2 Comoros              4.29  8.03          0.626                    NA  
 3 Panama               6.18 10.4           0.896                    NA  
 4 Maldives             5.20  9.83          0.913                    NA  
 5 Spain                6.49 10.6           0.932                    NA  
 6 Iraq                NA    NA            NA                        60.6
 7 Comoros             NA    NA            NA                        57.3
 8 Panama              NA    NA            NA                        69.7
 9 Maldives            NA    NA            NA                        70.6
10 Spain               NA    NA            NA                        74.7



Problem Three
Combine happy and happy_join_one by column

nrow(happy) == nrow(happy_join_one)

[1] TRUE

bind_cols(happy, happy_join_one)

# A tibble: 5 × 6
  country_name...1 ladder_score   gdp social_support country_name...5
  <chr>                   <dbl> <dbl>          <dbl> <chr>           
1 Iraq                     4.85  9.24          0.746 Iraq            
2 Comoros                  4.29  8.03          0.626 Comoros         
3 Panama                   6.18 10.4           0.896 Panama          
4 Maldives                 5.20  9.83          0.913 Maldives        
5 Spain                    6.49 10.6           0.932 Spain           
# ℹ 1 more variable: healthy_life_expectancy <dbl>



Problem Four
Which join function is a better alternative to the previous solution?

happy %>%
    inner_join(happy_join_one)

# A tibble: 5 × 5
  country_name ladder_score   gdp social_support healthy_life_expectancy
  <chr>               <dbl> <dbl>          <dbl>                   <dbl>
1 Iraq                 4.85  9.24          0.746                    60.6
2 Comoros              4.29  8.03          0.626                    57.3
3 Panama               6.18 10.4           0.896                    69.7
4 Maldives             5.20  9.83          0.913                    70.6
5 Spain                6.49 10.6           0.932                    74.7



Problem Five
Filter out all countries from happy_full that are also in happy

happy_full %>%
    anti_join(happy)
